instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: Hello everyone, i got a macbooka1465 that lags a lot when you move the cursor. The lagging is so bad that you can see the path of the cursor. is this some related to the gnu or current sensing resistor

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
[SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: Yeah, run EFI version of ASD if this is a pre 2014 model of course. Else run internal diagnostic by holding down "D"

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message:
i tried to the diagnostics and the only error i get is " the battery requires service Ref code:ppt004". Its noting too useful. can anyone one point me in the right direction?

Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
[SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: Yeah a battery stuck at 0% will cause lag.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: I tried a new batteru thatvwas 50% charged and same shit. Wth is causing this? Its driving me nuts

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: What board is this? Is it still supported by EFI version of ASD. It must be a sensor issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: The screen wasn't good. It was causing lagging issues. I replaced the screen and now it's working properly. No more lagging. The sensors were fine. You may mark this post as solved. Thanks for the help!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: That is weird. Did you try to just unplug the camera, that is what usually causes issues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> super slow; cursor lags
threads.message: Duke, Im still experiencing the same issue with the camera disconnected. It works properly with a new one FYI. You can close this post
